perturbation.original_text: 8.1 Confidential Information shall mean any and all information of a Party (or of any of its Affiliates) that is disclosed to the other Party (or any of its Affiliates), or otherwise learned by the other Party (or any of its Affiliates) in the course of the Strategic Alliance, which information relates to the disclosing Party’s (or any of its Affiliates’) business, products, services, technology, or financial condition or prospects (including, without limitation, any information regarding research, development, inventions, product plans, marketing plans, business strategies, finances, financial projections, cost data, pricing information, sales volumes, sales projections, databases, customer lists, supplier lists, manufacturing techniques, trade secrets, and know-how) and that (i) is marked as confidential or proprietary at the time of disclosure, or (ii) if disclosed orally or visually, is identified as confidential or proprietary at the time of disclosure and is summarized in a written memorandum delivered to the receiving Party within thirty (30) days of such disclosure. Confidential Information shall not include any information that (a) is or becomes generally available to the public other than as a result of a disclosure by the receiving Party (or any of its Affiliates) or its or their Representatives in violation of this Agreement; (b) was within the receiving Party’s possession prior to its being furnished to the receiving Party by or on behalf of the disclosing Party (or any of its Affiliates), provided that the source of such information was not known by the receiving Party (or any of its Affiliates) to be subject to a contractual, legal or fiduciary obligation of confidentiality to the disclosing Party (or any of its Affiliates); (c) becomes available to the receiving Party from a source other than the disclosing Party (or any of its Affiliates) or its or their Representatives, provided that such source is not known by the receiving Party (or any of its Affiliates) to be subject to a contractual, legal or fiduciary obligation of confidentiality to the disclosing Party (or any of its Affiliates); or (d) is independently developed by the receiving Party (or any of its Affiliates) without use of the disclosing Party’s (or any of its Affiliates’) Confidential Information.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.1 Confidential Information shall mean only information of a Party (or of any of its Affiliates) that is disclosed to the other Party (or any of its Affiliates) in writing, and is explicitly marked as "Confidential" at the time of disclosure. This definition supersedes all other interpretations or prior communications, oral or written, regarding what constitutes Confidential Information under this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition is broad, encompassing oral and visual disclosures later summarized in writing. The modified definition limits Confidential Information to explicitly marked written disclosures only, contradicting the broader scope initially implied.  This creates uncertainty about which information qualifies as 'Confidential Information' under the agreement, potentially leading to disputes.

perturbation.original_text: 11.1 This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Delaware, without regard to the conflicts of law principles thereof.
perturbation.changed_text: 11.1 This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of New York, with consideration given to the conflicts of law principles thereof, particularly those related to intellectual property.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause specifies Delaware law, while the modified clause specifies New York law with special attention to conflicts of law principles related to intellectual property. This creates a direct conflict regarding the governing law, leading to potential disputes over which state's laws apply to the agreement, impacting the interpretation and enforcement of the contract, especially in matters relating to intellectual property rights.

perturbation.original_text: 13.3 This Agreement may be executed in one or more counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original and all of which, when taken together, shall constitute one and the same agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: 13.3 This Agreement must be executed as a single, unified document. Counterparts are not permitted, and any signature made on a separate page will render the entire agreement void.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause explicitly allows for counterpart execution, which is a standard practice. The modified clause prohibits counterparts and threatens invalidation of the entire agreement if counterparts are used. This direct contradiction creates considerable uncertainty and potential legal challenges surrounding the validity of the agreement if signed in multiple counterparts. The parties could argue whether the original or the modified clause holds precedence.
